list_definition.definition: a box of wood, wire etc for holding birds or animals

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The lion has escaped from its cage
The miners enter a steel cage which descends down the mineshaft.
Some people think that it is cruel to cage wild animals.

list_ex_of_english: Traps were installed overnight and captured specimens were kept in cages in humid and cold conditions.

Collections from trap cages were at 30 min intervals.
Furthermore, during the experimental period there were no significant differences in infection rates between the cages.
To determine the actual fertility, for several seasons newly moulted males and females were kept until their death in outside wire cages.
No difference in larval survival was detected for caged larvae between habitats (table 1).
At the end of the experiment, the plants and the internal surface of the cages were inspected to record nymphs.
Correspondingly, sample fish were maintained in cages, artificially fed and treated with therapeutic products when necessary.
